Comment: "Dude, I'm totally gonna get like 500 coins this time," says a penguin ripping down the track. "I run through the cave and get sweet air with my 360s and backflips."
"Many of our customers come here for some quiet while they read the latest newspaper," explains a staff member. " Ballistic biscotti is our most popular menu item."
"I remember when Astro-Barrier came out. It was the first arcade game on the island!" recalls an avid gamer in the Lounge . "Have you found the secret levels yet?"
"The trick to a great cup of coffee is the time it takes to pour," explains the Coffee Stop staff. "Not too fast but not too slow, then save some room for marshmallows!"
"The landing pads around the island are built out of special alloys that disable them from being adversely affected by jet pack heat," explains Gary. "That means they're strong."
"First you start with the pizza dough, which gets flattened into pans," the chef continues. "Then it goes down the Pizzatron 3000 line and roasts in the oven."
"This one's my favorite story in the Book Room because it's about my favorite day of the year ," he says. "Besides, I love any story that involves aliens and flashlights."
"The Mine is so cool. I can see all kinds of stalactites on the ceiling," explains the scientist. "Stalactites are those things that look like icicles. Oh wait... they're just icicles."
"It's amazing what you can do with a plain old drill," notes a worker on a job site near the coast. "I've seen some nice red ones , but I like my trusty yellow drill. It does just the trick."
"I love going on adventures with my jet pack. I can almost navigate through the entire course without getting a single coin ," boasts the proud pilot. "It's not too easy, though..."
"I come in at least twice a week, I'd say," concludes the shopping penguin, decked out in the latest styles. "The diva glasses and The Sidetied wig are must haves."

Art: HIKING IN THE FOREST card image
Comment: "It's the perfect day for a hike in the Forest," says the penguin, holding her backpack on her shoulders. "Keeping active is really important, plus I love the great outdoors!"
"When you've got a penguin who's stuck in the snow / Just tell 'em exactly where to go / To the Rescue Squad on top of the hill / We know how to help and ya know we will!"
"This here is the puffle area, You'll be responsible for caring for these little critters," explains the Pet Shop owner. "The black one over there is a bit of a firecracker."
"I usually start a tour here at the Ski Village because it's so close to my tour booth ," explains a tour guide. It's a great place to build a group of tourists, too."
It's the day of the big game at the Sports Party as Team Red and Blue square off head-to-head. "This time the trophy belongs to Red!" shouts the challenger as the puck drops.
"This must be the place she was talking about with all the sledding penguins," says the red penguin. "Now what on earth is that pointy thing up there for?"
"Here comes a long one!" one penguin shouts. "Yikes! That was close!" shrieks the other penguin. "Guess I'm better with water balloons..."
"I'm practicing my snowball pitch. I pretend this is the pitcher's mound , then wind up and let it fly. The Snow Forts are the perfect place to test out your pitching arm.
"Okay, look. Let's get this straight. I know some penguins out west call it a soccer ball, but it's football . Now that you understand the game, ready to try and score a goal?"
"I remember when the Beach opened as though it was yesterday," replies one island veteran. "We threw a big barbecue with the fish we caught. Ahhh... those were golden days..."
"10... 24... 5... hut!" shouts the quarterback as he makes a run for it across the field, racing for the 10-yard line. "Team Red's not gonna win it this time," he thinks as he's running...
"BATTER UP!" shouts the umpire as Team Red's pitcher readies the first throw of the big ball game. "This one's for the Blue Team!" shouts the batter as the ball flies towards the plate...
"Welcome to my beautiful enchanted castle!" beams the sparkly princess penguin. "I'm looking for my wand, which I seem to have misplaced. Could you help me look for it?"
"Why do they insist on delivering more fish?!" exclaims the employee catching the order from the delivery truck. "Is it just me or are there more fish than java bags here?"
"When you lift this manhole cover up, you'll see that it leads down to the pool ," explains the Tour Guide. "And since we're not using out maps right now, shall we continue?"
"Sometimes I don't get a chance to read the newspaper , so I catch up with the past issues in the Boiler Room," says the lime green penguin. "I don't want to miss any comics!"
"Hey, do you remember when there wasn't a pool in here?" asks one of the penguins. "I remember a party where we were dancing on the ground in this very spot!"
"While Rockhopper travels at seas to find treasures, I prefer to search at home," the diver explains. "See! Check it out! A coral crown thing ! Diving totally rules."
"I think the last time I was here, I caught about 10 fish," he replies. "I'm not in a rush when I go fishing. To me, it's about fun, not finance. If I need coins, I help at the Pet Shop."

Art: CASE OF THE MISSING COINS card image
Comment: "You totally saved my feathers there," sighs the relieved rookie agent . "I thought I was never going to get back into the vault after I closed the door! Oops, I guess!"
"EVERYONE MAKE WAY FOR BOXMAN!" shouts the penguin in the superhero mask. "I shall put all evildoers into my superboxes for shipment to 'No More Bad Guys Land'!"
The residents of Club Penguin appreciate a good anvil â€“ that's why so many are sent to the Coffee Shop every day. "I'd say I make about 30 on a good day," replies one anvil smith.
"Check it out! I'm a ghost bunny professor!" explains the orange penguin. "I want to have the coolest costume for this solar eclipse party at my buddy's igloo. Do you think I'll win?"
"Let's pretend to be knights and princesses. I'll be the Knight of Light and you can be the Princess of Power," says the green penguin. "Oh no! Here comes a dragon..."
"Turbo is my black puffle. It rolls its eyes a lot," replies the penguin as he feeds his pet a flipper full of Puffle O's. "It really gets fired up when I take it out for a walk."
"For this event we collaborated with Penguin Style's fashion designers to make an epic party ," says one planner, dressed in a knight's garb. "I still wear my party clothes today."
"As an employee, I value the blue puffles," replies the staff member. "They are loyal, easy to take care of, and fun to play ball with. You can't go wrong with a blue puffle."
"This is my pink puffle, Cutie! I named it that because I think its eyes are sooo adorable," continues the ballet dancer. "Plus it matches my outfit!"
"My puffle Greenie is the silliest puffle I've ever met, which is why we get along so well," she giggles. "I love it when it plays on its unicycle â€“ it's so funny!"
"No igloo would be complete without accessories for your cute little puffle pets," the decorator explains. "Puffles love having furniture just as much as penguins!"
"Oh! Look at that one over there blowing bubbles! That one is sooo cute â€“ it should be my pet," she exclaims. "I'll name it Princess Purple because I love princesses and purple!"
"This is my sidekick on my adventures. I named it Fireball because it's so fast when it goes flying out of its cannon like whoooosh ! Look, it's going again!"
"I knew I wanted a yellow puffle from the moment I saw it in the Forest at Halloween ," she replies. "My puffle Lemon likes to paint just like I do."
"The Summer Party sticks out the most in my mind as the one to beat," proclaims one penguin. "You can't top great buddies acting crazy and having fun."
"You ain't gonna get a bite without the Flashing Lure , sonny," the experienced brown fisherman explains. "Them gray ones are only attracted to real bright light."
"These berries grow on shrubs in the forest clearing," explains our nature guide. "Puffles love to eat them because of their tart sweetness."
"Having a life ring handy is really important to us," the lifeguard continues as she keeps watch over the Pool. "Hey, that crab is knocking on the glass over there!"
"Arrr, this be the black flag atop me ship," growls Rockhopper as we tour the Migrator. "I be liking to name things, so I be callin' this one the Jolly Roger."
"Coins are the widely accepted monetary system around the island," explains the scholarly account penguin. "That means penguins use them to buy stuff."

Art: GARY THE GADGET GUY card image
Comment: "I have been conducting research on the combustion of hydrogen and oxygen," Gary continues. "Jet pack fuel is important on the island as it allows penguins to adventure."
"I'm trying to find the elusive Boo-Eee #4," replies the penguin sleuth. "They're hidden all over, and I think they're supposed to protect the island from bad weather or something."
"Me beloved best buddy Yarr has been by me side e'er since we met on Rockhopper Island ," the burly captain replies. "It be a loyal friend, keepin' watch me Crow's Nest."
Klutzy: "CLICK CLICK CLICK." Crab Translator 3000 : "I'm hungry." Klutzy: "CLA-CLICKA-CLICK CLICK-CLICK." Crab Translator 3000: "I'm still hungry."
"Why hello there, penguin. It is I, Herbert P. Bear, Esquire. Aren't you fortunate to have discovered my magnificent card. I am confident that you will treasure this picture."
"It is I, the alien Dojo master, hai ya! I will reveal to you the hidden ingredient of my pizza masterpieces... the amazing Hot Sauce â€“ guaranteed to spice up any dish!"
"I think it took like a day and a half to make this," recalls one snow artist. "I don't really remember. I just know that we had to test to make sure penguins could walk on it."
"Hello! Aloha! Oi! I am so exhilarated to have my photograph taken for such a prestigious event. This is my desk, where I read the letters I receive and wrestle with writer's block."
"Ooooh eee oooooh!" sing the carolers as they practice their songs to serenade the town. During the holidays, the trees are trimmed with fresh snow and holiday cheer echoes throughout the island.
"We didn't have many decorations then â€“ just a simple banner," explains a penguin wearing a party hat . "But we wanted to celebrate our hard work somehow, and penguins love a good party!"
"I found the hidden viking helmet !" he says, leafing through the latest issue of Penguin Style . "I'm totally going to add this to my pirate policeman outfit. What do you think?"
"One rule we have about being a secret agent is that you don't talk about secret agents," says the tight-billed penguin in the suit. "No other comments at this time."
"I never go anywhere without my trusty shovel. I know a lot of penguins prefer their drills, but I get a sense of reward using my shovel to move the snow around."
"Arrr mateys! Ye be gazin' at me good ship, the Migrator! It be a mighty ship of vim and vigor that has lasted many tumbles," replies Rockhopper. "Nary a better boat there be."
"Arrr... ye be gazin' at me glorious card. Ahhhh, a sight for sore eyes this fantastic photo be. It be remindin' me of many voyages across the seas with treasures seized!"
"There I am eating ice cream at the Beach again!" exclaims the penguin as she gets her beach towel ready. "Yes, it's true, ice cream and the Beach are a great pair."
"Penguins from far and wide come to this ice fishing hole to see if they can catch this legendary big fish. Someone told me I need bigger bait though, so I brought a pizza."
"Oh no! That crab over there tapped the glass and now there's a leak and there's water pouring out and there's going to be water everywhere what are we going to do now!?"
"Here fishy fishy fishy!" calls the red penguin. "I don't think Fluffy has ears," his friend replies. "Neither do we, but I can hear you..." "Hmmm. Guess you've got a point there."
"I know there's a big fish down there, but I don't think it's that one with the great big mean teeth and shark fin on top," the rookie fisherman says. "That's not Mullet, is it?"
"Dude. Soooo love the shades. They make me even stronger and more silent. Maybe later we can hang out and I'll eat a Puffle O to entertain 'ya."
"You think this is fast? You should see how I move when I get shot from a cannon! It's a riot! And I think, actually, it increases happiness."
"Paints, creativity, and music," Chirp replies with whimsy. "Mix those together and you got a masterpiece, my friends, a masterpiece!"
"I love bubbles! They're beautiful to blow. Bouncy. Breathtaking. Transparent perfection, I say!"
"Hmm... I wonder if my lasso would work the same under water. I mean, it'd be super cool to see if I could round up some pearls , wouldn't it?
"Um, nope! Can't touch this propeller hat," Flit laughs loudly. "It takes tons of practice... Even I need it! Recall Christmas 2008 when I got stuck sideways in a tree ?!"
"It's so cool to bounce around like my ball," he declares. "By the way... it rolled under a ginormous pile of snow and though I'm small, round and can roll, I'm a bit too puffy. Can you help?"

Art: ED MCCOOL AND DESTRUCTO card image
Comment: "Dear Gary, met two very talented puffles on an important PSA mission today. Will have to keep a look out for them in the future. They may be useful someday..."
"From this snowman emerges the almighty Niblet, the might green puffle! He's been trying to become a white puffle by hiding in the snow."
Penguins and puffles never get tired of the snow falling in Club Penguin. Best friends like to take some timeout from their busy life to watch it fall together.

Art: PUFFLES ON THE LOOSE card image
Comment: Sometimes rounding up puffles feels a little like chasing a rainbow. Lots of colors, but the closer you get the farther away it seems.

Art: CADENCE AND THE KEEPER card image
Comment: "Yeah, this little green guy is an epic win," Cadence grinned. "He's got all the right moves. He usually knows where the party's at. He's definitely a Keeper, lolz!"
Such a popular myth, they made a Stage play about it. Does this puffle really live under the 'berg?
Swoosh, the mysterious meteor puffle flies through the air with the greatest of ease...
A multi-colored legend, or just a creative little yellow puffle who has been playing with paint?
"I'm telling ya, it was huge! Twice the size of a penguin and it had claws like a crab . I was shaking in my snow boots!"
"Extra! Extra! Every Thursday the Club Penguin Times delivers the latest scoop on everything that's happening on the island. From fun art to stories to games, there's something new every week!"
Anyone who's planning to go ice fishing behind the Ski Lodge needs a can of worms. Having this squirmy bait ready is the first step to catching a fishy treat.
"I was at the first Winter Fiesta way back in 2007," she explained. "I missed the one in 2008 , so I was totally stoked to see it again in 2009 !
"The Invisibility Suit is one of the tools of the ninja. Available only from the Martial Artworks store, it allows ninja to vanish into the shadows. Useful AND cool."
Through rain, sleet, and snow, the Penguin Mail will always get through. But mostly through snow... and actually they've never seen rain, but still.
"This is my favorite Halloween costume, the Bumble Bee! I picked this one up last year when they were on sale at the Gift Shop ."
Making pizzas in the Pizza Parlor can be tricky. Chefs need a steady hand and concentration of steel to prepare pizza pies perfectly for all their hungry costumers!

To become a ninja, one must first learn to master the elements. It all begins with Card-Jitsu, and this card you hold in your hand . Proceed to the Dojo, and take your first step on a legendary path...

Puffles are the cute little furballs you see penguins waddling around with next to them. You can even take them into games like Aqua Grabber ! Drop by the Pet Shop in the Plaza to adopt one of your very own.
This trendy outfit is popular for its sparkle and "pizzazz!" It was first released in the Gift Shop, just before Music Jam '08 , one of the biggest parties of the year.
"There's construction going on all over the place in Club Penguin all the time. Penguins on the island love to build and create, so construction is a pretty popular job around here!
"These charming, limited edition collector's items are a must have for any treasure hunter... a brand new one is hidden every two weeks somewhere on the island!"

"Rockhopper's Treasure Hunt game is kinda rare. You can only play it when his ship, the Migrator, is docked on the Beach. Remember, you need his key from that book to get into the Quarters on the ship.

DJ3K at the Night Club is a music-makin' penguin's favorite game. "It's simple, yo. Just start pushin' buttons and the groove kicks in. Every good beat needs a little cowbell, so I like to mix that into my sets."
"The only thing you need to 'catch some waves' down at the Cove; penguins can borrow a board or buy their own at the Surf Shack. Then they just need to catch a 'gnarly' wave and 'hang ten!'"
"Chilling out" at the Beach is even easier when the beach is made of snow. Sun glasses are optional, but you add that touch of "cool" while you "chill."
"If you look through the telescope at the Beacon, you can see all the way out to sea. It's a good place to keep a close eye out for Rockhopper."
"Don't give me that look..." said the penguin. "It's just a costume. I'm trying to get a part in a play at the Stage, and I need expert advice. Now are you going to help me or not?"
Yarr's favorite place on the Migrator is up in the Crow's Net. You can see for miles, and take out any rogue icebergs with the ship's snowball cannon.
"Other penguins like to come to the Cove to surf, but I just love to gaze out at the water. I was the first one to spot a huge storm one time through the binoculars ! The ocean can tell you a lot."
"Rockhopper used to keep his quarters locked," the tour guide says. "But now you just need to find his key to get in..."
"If we tipped this over, what do you think we'd find on the other side?" one penguin inquires. "It's the biggest mystery of all," they replied. "We've got to find a way to tip it.
The Lounge is located upstairs from the Night Club, and it's the perfect place to "chill" and play arcade games. Can you master the tricky "Thin Ice" or pilot the "Astro Barrier" to victory?

"Arr! Ye be needin' this special key to get into me Captain's Quarters on me good ship the Migrator!" Rockhopper chuckled. "I hid it somewhere on the island. Ye might want to "book" some time to find it..."

Art: Penguins That Time Forgot card image (ID 225)
Comment: "Dinosaurs, lava, time-traveling... this was one of my favorite plays," she explained. "Watch this, I'll be a cave penguin... 'GRUB! FIRE ROAST MARSHMALLOW!'"
Rallying at the Stage for epic competitions, the Red Team and Blue Team wrote another chapter of their rivalry with the introduction of their moose mascots.

"For those looking to experience the thrill of flying, look no further than Jet Pack Adventure," said the Tour Guide. "Just head to the top of the Lighthouse, strap on a pack, and take off! Parachutes provided!"

Art: Ruby and the Ruby card image
Comment: "See, here's the shimmy â€“ this classy lady named Ruby had lost her ruby . A victim of poetic irony, I know. She needed my help, and she needed it fast..." - Jacques Hammer
Snowballs can be used for all types of purposes, from snowball fights to tennis matches. "I like to throw rapid-fire by hitting 'T' on my keyboard constantly. TURBO THROW!"

"The Snowball Press publishes all the great books Club Penguin has to offer, like Rockhopper's Journal and Penguin Tales . Check 'em out in the room above the Coffee Shop. Remember: every word counts!"
"I love a good music festival," he responded. "Music Jam 2008 was probably my favorite party. I finally got to meet Penguin Band, and DJ3K came out for the first time!"
"My black puffle just loves the scratching post I bought him from the Pet Shop. But I can't figure out why he keeps trying to eat it! Maybe I need to feed him some Puffle O's."

"My fave play's definitely Fairy Fables , cuz it's got the Big Bad Wool costume in it. I wear the sheep costume and my buddy dresses up like the prince from the story and we make up our own plays in the Forest."
These rare Antarctic jelly fish can produce a small electric charge that can make for a 'shocking' experience for Ice Fishing experts who may snag one on their line.
"Arr! Only the bravest penguins join me pirate crew!" says Rockhopper. "Smartly now, sailors â€“ where be yer sea flippers?"
The fish around Club Penguin won't just up and eat and old bait. In fact, each kind of fish has their own favorite food. Fishing experts recommend trying different types of bait for best results.

"Catchin' a ride on the ol' Hydro Hopper at the Dock is sweet," the Tour Guide explained. "Catching air and sailing over obstacles is not only fun, but will earn you extra coins. Come on, give it a try!"

"Though puffles enjoy cookies, and a stick of gum now and then, their favorite food is Puffle O's, without a doubt," said the Puffle Handler . "Make sure not to overfeed them though, because they might get a tummy ache."

"Once a year the Fall Fair comes to Club Penguin with a whole bunch of special games," said the Tour Guide. "These games award tickets you can trade for sweet prizes. And I mean 'sweet.' Their cotton candy is delicious!"

"Oh, you've heard of the Thing-ma-jig 3000?" Gary asked. "Oh yes, it's quite a clever little device, but it's hidden away in my Gadget Room. It's so well hidden in that you'd have to be some kind of secret agent to find it."
This unique Halloween costume first appeared in October 2008, when Gary the Gadget Guy was working on the Monster Maker 3000 invention in his secret lab . "Spookalicious!"

"Truly we are the most bizarre costumes that can be purchased from the Stage..." scoffed Qua. "I don't know..." answered Quip. "I saw a squid monster with a sheep face walking around." "Well," replies Qua, "other than that guy..."
The fairy storyteller from the Fairy Fables play at the Stage. Twee loves to mix things up to keep it fresh â€“ from colors to stories, things are never quite ordinary in her library!

"They say it's better to give than to receive and that's totally tree with Coins for Change. There's always amazing amounts of generosity when penguins decide to change the world! Waddle around and make difference!"

Art: Surfing with the Sharks card image
Comment: "And I was like, woah, it's a shark! And it was like 'RAH!' and then I was like whoa, it's a shark! And you shoulda seen it man. I mean, it was huge â€“ it was mahoosive!"
"Any penguin brave enough to stand up, talk the talk, walk the walk, and bust out their icy best moves is an epic win here in the Dance Club."

"What's wackier than an octopus showing up in the middle of a party? Nothing! That's epic wacky! This inflatable octopus tends to show up at the strangest of times, so keep your eyes open for other appearances!"
"I'm telling you, the Squid is totally real. I was deep below the Iceberg in the Aqua Grabber one day when it went zipping past me going 'EAAAUUUUURGGGGH!'. We need to find it!"
This item is sometimes found in the Costume Trunk at the Stage. Once you have a camera, wave to snap award-winning photos all over the island.
All wigs can be found in Penguin Style catalog in the Gift Shop. Every penguin should have one â€“ from punk to surfer â€“ they really complete an outfit!
Be a chef! Make pizzas in the Pizzatron 3000 game in the kitchen. Put on your red apron and dance to serve customers in the restaurant.
Secret Agents will find this machine in the Coffee Shop during the Secret of the Fur mission. It will help you save the island.
You'll find this at the Stage â€“ and it's never empty! Open it and choose an outfit. You could be a brave explorer , a scientist , a lobster , a he ro , a time traveler ... anything you want! [3]
The employees in the Pet shop love looking after puffles! With the orange apron on, you can dance to serve them food. Look for it from time to time in Penguin Style .
The laid back bass player of Penguin Band. He keeps the beat with bandmate G Billy and loves to play the jazzy stuff.
The founder of and drummer for Penguin Band. If you ever get the chance to meet him Backstage during Music Jam and be sure to get an autographed background by clicking his player card!
Penguins with outdoor areas for their igloos can throw amazing parties. Check out Better Igloos for cool furniture, like this BBQ . Oh the gnome ? Every party should have one!
You never know who will sell you a ticket for the latest Stage performance at the Plaza. Sometimes actors man the booth between shows!
It's the toughest Sled Racing run on the Ski Hill. Up to four penguins can race together, so if you're serious about challenging your buddies, this is the way to do it!
Ready, set, throw snow! Find this snowball-powered clock in the Snow Forts. Throw snowballs at the target to help keep it powered. Just press T on your keyboard and click the red target!"
First discovered in February '09, these critters are known to be gentle but powerful. Adopt one from the Pet Shop and discover what it can turn to ice with a single breath!
This is the outside of the Dojo and it was uncovered by penguins in November 2008 . To get here, you must use your map.
This ginormous rocking horse somehow found itself upstairs in the Lodge Attic. To see it for yourself, go to the Ski Village and climb the ladder inside the Ski Lodge.
There's new stuff in this catalog every month! Why not get your friends together in the Gift Shop and check it out? Pick out new outfits, then hold a fashion show in your igloo!

Directors needed! Located in the Plaza, the Stage has new plays every month and always needs actors, stagehands, and even directors to make every performance a success. Grab a costume from the catalog and break a leg!
This outfit showed up in the Penguin Style during Music Jam. When penguins put it on and danced, they conducted orchestras all over the island.
From the top of the Lighthouse, you can look through the telescope to see if there's sign of Rockhopper's ship or play the game Jet Pack Adventure.
There's two secret passages to the underground. You'll find this one in the Plaza. To find the other passage, head to the room with the best beats and pay attention to the speaker on the far right.
This cool lead guitarist of Penguin Band loves to hang out with other music fans around the island. Find him with his bandmates Backstage during Music Jam and receive an autographed background.
The talented pianist and accordion player in the Penguin Band. He's always bursting with new song ideas and loves to share them with audiences around the island.
Penguins learned a new dance with this item when Cadence showed up with it during a party in the Night Club. If you have the item, wear it and press D on your keyboard and see what you can do!
This character appears in Shadow Guy and Gamma Gal vs. Squidzoid at the Stage. He's a bit of a shy guy, but he's just as important as the ones with the super powers!
Appearing at the Stage Dec. 2007, this Shakespearean style comedy stared a Bard , a Countess , a Jester and (obviously) a Fish who couldn't stop blubbing. "BUT NEVER DOUBT I BLUB!"

Art: April Fool's Day Party card image
Comment: It's a celebration where things happen that can't happen! Discover the wacky and unexpected with friends across the island at this party â€“ from surprise-filled boxes to new dimensions !
You can light up the Stage with Gamma Gal's incredible Plasma Glow Wave during every performance of Shadow Guy and Gamma Gal vs. Squidzoid . Wear the costume and wave to activate the special power.
First available at the Music Jam '09 party, this item is still a hit across the island! To join in the fun, press D on your keyboard while wearing the item.
Puffles love them and it's a good thing too! When they get hungry it's the best meal to recharge their energy. O'Berries grow in the wild and are always in full supply on your puffle's player card.

Art: Chester The Time Traveler card image
Comment: In Penguins that Time Forgot at the Stage, this curious character finds himself on an adventure back in time surrounded by dinosaurs and cave penguins.
There's always a lot to discover around the island and in 2009, for 101 days straight, penguins had fun completing a new activity every day!
The 2009 color vote was an epic battle between Lavender , Maroon and Aqua . Penguins voted in the Forest and the winning color was added to the Penguin Style catalog as a new penguin color.
Holiday spirit takes over the island during this party! This is the Photo Booth in the Forest where penguins posed for pictures with Santa.
Be part of this popular Stage show, as a detective, ghost, or even the Viking Opera singer. Put on the Viking wig and dance, following along to the script.
Most penguins have had a snowball fight at the Snow Forts. But at the Water Party , the splat of water balloons replacing the thud of snow. Too cool!
At the Music Jam '09 party, this item was popular at the Lighthouse stage. When you wore it and danced, you could even hear it playing!
The captain of the Migrator brought these plants to the island in 2009. Penguins put them in their igloos and they started to grow! Every few weeks they change â€“ even to this day!
During this June 2009 party, after Rockhopper's plants took over the island, penguin explorers discovered rare flowers â€“ some that changed colors and others that liked to eat snowballs !
Penguins called this one of 2009's coolest events. They voted for their favorite stage plays, got to meet Penguin Band and Aunt Arctic, and enjoyed dressing up to receive their own awards!
During Music Jam '09 party, this pass got penguins into the Backstage and Night Club Rooftop where they hung out with friends and had a chance to meet Penguin Band and Cadence.
Cadence is a very popular penguin around here! She makes appearances at big events like the Penguin Play Awards. You can meet her and receive an autographed background by clicking her player card.
This book contains the best collection of rare and exclusive items. Look for a code with select toys and enter at clubpenguin.com to gain access to this special catalog.
You might spot more than a few penguins wearing this popular item. When it appears in Penguin Style , the Gift Shop always has plenty in stock!
Penguins flew for the first time when they danced while wearing this item at the 2006 April Fool's Day Party. Penguins aren't the only ones who like these caps though â€“ check out the green puffles!
One of the island's best kept secrets. Make Dessert Pizza in the Pizza Parlor's Pizzatron 3000 game by clicking on the lever of the machine when you enter the game!
This limited edition instrument is available from the Penguin Style catalog in the Gift Shop from time to time. To play it, put it on and dance. Go solo or join a band!
Fire. Snow. Water. That's what you'll need to master the Card-Jitsu game. Train with your friends and Sensei at the Dojo to earn belts and become a ninja.
This super-secret agency has one goal: to protect the Club Penguin island. Their base, the Command Room , is hidden near the Ski Village.
Battle up to 3 other ninjas in Card-Jitsu Fire, the ultimate test of speed and power. Land on an element, play your cards and the highest number will win.

Card name: Fire Battle (named "Hot Sauce" in real-life cards)
Comment: Skilled ninjas show their mastery of the element of fire, battling with hot sauce. They never spill a drop on their ninja suit and they don't fear it on their pizza.
Ninja students all over the island helped to stoke the fires of a longâ€“dormant Volcano in the hills of Club Penguin. Even their black puffles joined in!
Here's a tip if you're a ninja, you can buy a Goldsmith Apron inside the Hideout (beside the Dojo). If you wear this item then dance, your penguin will forge gold!

Card name: Scroll (named "Ninja Battle Scroll" in real-life cards)
Comment: Ninjas face off in a match of Card-Jitsu Fire atop the great Volcano. Each ninja student must master the element of fire to earn legendary items such as the Fire Gem.

Card name: Volcano (named "The Volcano Awakens" in real-life cards)
Comment: This distant mountain in the hills of Club Penguin had lay dormant for years. It wasn't until September 2009 that penguins realized that is was actually a Volcano!

Card name: Ready For Battle (named "Prepare For Battle" in real-life cards)
Comment: Ninjas practice their Card-Jitsu poses before pouncing into action. Here, we see a ninja preparing to go into a Card-Jitsu Fire battle, where you must play the best element card to win.
Only ninjas can access this quaint little shop at the heart of the Ninja Hideout beside the Dojo. The magical Amulet is the most popular item sold here.

Card name: Duel (named "Card-Jitsu Fire Duel" in real-life cards)
Comment: Land on this square in a game of Card-Jitsu Fire, and youâ€™ll face a battle against another ninja. Remember, fire beats snow, snow beats water, water beats fire.

Card name: Concentrate (named "Sensei's Game Face" in real-life cards)
Comment: Once you have earned all the pieces of your Fire Suit , you must challenge Sensei and win. Only then will you earn your Fire Gem to become a Fire Ninja !

Card name: Interior Construction (named "Building The Entrance" in real-life cards)
Comment: Back in September 2009, construction on the entrance to the Volcano began at the Hideout. Sensei built a path to the top of the Volcano, and we worked together to build the Fire Dojo!

Card name: Elements Hideout (named "Amulet Inscription" in real-life cards)
Comment: See how the fire symbol glows? Once a ninja student has mastered the element of fire, Sensei will award them with a Fire Gem . Only then will the fire symbol glow in the Ninja Hideout.

Card name: Scavenger Hunt (named "The Quest For Fire" in real-life cards)
Comment: Sensei asked ninja students to gather fiery items from all over the island. We used these items to stoke the Volcano. It was time for our next ninja journey!

Card name: Fire Wheel (named "Stoking The Volcano" in real-life cards)
Comment: Ninjas gathered fiery items from all around the island to make the Volcano even hotter. It sparked great events, starting with a great storm which hit the island just before Halloween.
This card does not exist in real-life, and as such has no description

Card name: Fire Dance (named "Fire Ninja Stance" in real-life cards)
Comment: Here's a hot tip if you're a Fire Ninja, wear these 4 items: Flame Sandals , Magma Coat , Lava Mask & Fiery Helmet . Then hit D on your keyboard. Behold the Fire Stance!

Card name: Sketched Action (named "Ninja Sketches" in real-life cards)
Comment: We drew these ninjas back in August 2009 while we were working up some stuff for Card-Jitsu Fire. Some of these were made into real world "pop-up" cards.

Card name: Fire Guardian (named "Fire Ninja Statue" in real-life cards)
Comment: The powerful stone statues at the Fire Dojo watch over ninja students as they learn to master the element of fire. Beyond the mighty Fire Suit!

Card name: Hot Sauce Reserve (named "Tub Of Hot Sauce" in real-life cards)
Comment: We aren't quite sure about this tub of hot sauce at the Fire Dojo. Is it pouring hot sauce into the Volcano, or is the lava actually hot sauce? This mystery remains...

Card name: Sketched: Volcano (named "Fire Dojo Sketch" in real-life cards)
Comment: Here's the original sketch of the Fire Dojo from May 2009. In the finished version we added a tub of hot sauce, and changed the outfit on the statue a bit!
Sensei first appeared outside the Dojo in November 2008 , where he was seen digging snow with a shovel. Almost a year later, he helped awaken the great Volcano...

Card name: Sketched: Enter (named "Volcano Entrance Sketch" in real-life cards)
Comment: This is a sketch we drew of Sensei in front of the Volcano entrance. We made this for a scene on our website back in September 2009, but ended up never using it!
Behold the Amulet! A symbol of power and skill, and a key to mastering the element of fire. Once you have mastered the element of fire, the Fire Gem will glow! [1]

Card name: A New Journey (named "Journey To The Volcano" in real-life cards)
Comment: Take the next step along the ninja path. Journey across the narrow bridge to the Fire Dojo, where you will learn to master the element of fire to become a Fire Ninja.

Card name: Fire Door & Key (named "Volcano Entrance" in real-life cards)
Comment: The entrance to the Volcano can only be opened by those who own the Amulet. To enter, click the stone table and uncover the hidden door to the secret Fire Dojo.

Card name: Sensei Fire (named " Sensei's Fire Robes " in real-life cards)
Comment: Sensei is a master of Card-Jitsu Fire. As you challenge other ninja students and earn experience, Sensei will award you with pieces of the Fire Ninja Suit.
A quick-thinking trickster, always ready for adventure. The Monkey King must face a great quest in the play " Secrets of the Bamboo Forest ".
Soaring through the air at top speed, penguin pilots master the art of Jet Packing. Head to the Beacon to take off on Jet Pack Adventure!
Fairies and Princesses go together like fish and pizza. Both have been spotted during plays, Halloween, and the Medieval Party.
Does your puffle want to try out a new hairdo? These salon chairs first appeared during the Puffle Party 2010. They are now available in the Pet Shop.
Every year for Halloween, more and more costumes appear at the Gift Shop. Trick-or-treaters should not be surprised to see dragons or Franken-fairies around the island.
During the Halloween Party, penguins looking to show off their custom costumes can waddle over to the costume show. Monsters and ladybugs alike are welcome!
Soccer is a very popular pastime on the island. Whether two or twenty two penguins are playing, the action is always epic. Get your game on at the Stadium!
Unloading the Coffee Shop truck is one of the oldest jobs on the island. And as long as penguins need their coffee, the Coffee Shop will need someone to help unload the beans.
As part of the Earth Day celebration , penguins decided to help clean up the island. A new Recycling Depot was built, and everyone took part in a huge recycling scavenger hunt .
During the Penguin Play Awards, interviewers are always busy. Everyone is invited to sit in the chair and share their thoughts on the Stage plays and awards. Everyone!
To play soccer at the Stadium, you've got to be quick. Click on the soccer ball to run over and kick it. The faster you're going, the faster the ball will go!
These are sketches of characters from "Secrets of the Bamboo Forest". We drew lots of different designs for their costumes before we decided on these ones.

Art: The Mine Cave is Safe! card image
Comment: When a rockslide in the Mine revealed hidden caves, crews moved in to make them safe to explore. "We're off to a rocky start," said Rory, "but that's normal for a cave."
Revealed by a rockslide in January of 2010, this dark cave is a construction worker's dream. Penguins can mine for gold with jackhammers, or help keep the lights powered with snowballs.
This costume from "Secrets of the Bamboo Forest" gives you the power to turn into a statue. Just press 'W' on your keyboard! The perfect skill for patient guardians...
Every September, penguins look forward to the island's famous Fair. There are many special games, prizes and shows to see... so step right up!
Hockey players can find all their equipment in the Snow and Sports catalog at the Stadium. The proper gear is important before stepping onto the ice.
The Puffle Show premiered during the Puffle Party in 2010. Penguins took their furry friends there to compete in an exciting obstacle course.
During the Holiday Party in 2009 , a special postcard allowed penguins to send a gift to their friends. Wrapped inside each was a Candy Cane Hat .
Even during the colder months, many penguins enjoy bundling up and playing in the snow. Making snowmen, caroling and snowball fights are very popular activities during this time.
The Stadium was upgraded to allow bigger crows to attend hockey and soccer games. Complete with bleachers, new lighting and booths for food vendors.
Nothing spruces up an igloo like a few items from the Better Igloos catalog. Puffles especially love it when there are lots of things to play with.
Music Jam is the island's annual music festival. It's all about finding the right styles, sounds and moves to express yourself.
This sketch shows an Elite Agent locating his Field-Op . We wanted to show the Spy Phone up close, and we thought it looked best having an agent hold it from the top.
During the Festival of Flight, penguins celebrated the many different ways to fly. They used jetpacks , propeller hats , hot air balloons, and more to get the island "off the ground".
During the Festival of Flight, many penguins used the Test Glider to take to the skies. Aviator goggles were a must have!
You need fast flippers and sharp reflexes to play Puffle Paddle. Juggle as many puffles as you can, and earn tons of tickets in this popular Fair game.
The island's fanciest fashions can be seen on the red carpet during the Penguin Play Awards. All the latest styles can be found at the Gift Shop.
Visitors to the Dock will find the Hydro Hopper boat all fueled up and ready to go. Jump in for some extreme tubing, or just chill out and catch some sun.
The zaniest of all puffles, these curious creatures were first discovered at the Puffle Party in 2010 . Their buckteeth and quirky personalities make them stand out in any crowd.
The entire community of Club Penguin helped plant this special tree during the Earth Day celebration in 2010. Many believe it will be the tallest tree on the island someday.
Many penguins have a passion for gardening. So during the Earth Day celebration in 2010, a community garden was planted at the Mine Shack. Now anyone can go there and plant vegetables!
In June of 2010, penguins were invited to dress up as pirates, captains, and even castaways. Mermaids and sailors in seafaring dresses were also spotted during the celebration.
In 2010, the Better Igloos catalog began selling clothing racks and displays so penguins could set up their own shops. Now there are many unique and interesting showing up all over the island,
A popular costume during the Island Adventure Party. The Seafarer's Gown and Bonny Curls were perfect for any gal that wanted to sail while looking their best.
Music Jam is about more than just music! The island's annual festival is about finding the best styles and sounds to express yourself, including your best dance moves.

Art: Music Jam Rock Stage card image
Comment: Rock is a popular style of music during Music Jam, the island's annual music festival. Many penguins enjoy breaking out there electric guitars and rocking out at the Lighthouse.

Art: Music Jam Pop Stage card image
Comment: Pop concerts are a huge hit with audiences. During the Music Jam festival, the Beach is set up with all the lights and sound systems a pop star needs!
Daring Daisy and Fearless Fiesel star in this Stage Play. Join them as they journey to discover the hidden underwater city of Penglantis!
This Stage play featured Norman , a shrunken penguin who must befriend a swarm of bugs to help him. Together they find a way to return Norman to his normal size.
Puffle rescuers need to have quick reflexes, and nerves of steel. Navigating dangerous ice floes, treacherous caverns and dangerous creatures is all part of the job.
This is an average Everyday Phoning Facility, over in the Ski Village. There's nothing to see here... unless you happen to receive an invitation to the Elite Penguin Force...
Gary the Gadget Guy, inventor of the jet pack, makes sure there's always enough for everyone. That makes a LOT of jet packs.
Nothing says Halloween like pumpkins for your igloo... except make a pumpkin igloo! This special igloo design only appears during Halloween in the Igloo Upgrades catalog.
A great treasure hunt was held during the Island Adventure Party. Penguins had to search for pieces of a lost map , to find where treasure was buried. X marked the spot!
In May of 2010, PSA agents were called in to stop one of Herbert's plans. Though agents saved everyone from harm, Herbert managed to destroy the PSA's HQ with a popcorn device.
During the Island Adventure Party, a group of classy captains banded together to try and battle the pirates. They did their best to find more treasure, and have more adventures than anyone else.
April Fools is a strange but funny celebration in Club Penguin. There's all sorts of weird silliness happening. It's easy to join in,-pull a prank, or tell a crazy joke.

Art: The Great Snow Maze card image
Comment: During November of 2009, penguins were invited to solve the Great Snow Maze. Many penguins worked together to reach the end, and were awarded with a Yeti costume .
This penguin private investigator is one of the stars of the Stage play "Ruby and the Ruby". He's a no-nonsense penguin who doesn't miss a clue, and always finds what he's looking for.

Art: Throne of April Fools card image
Comment: During the April Fools Party, the entire island goes topsy-turvy. Those who join in the fun may even be crowned the King of April Fools... though kings are crowned every few minutes.
To join the Elite Penguin Force, first you must complete The Test. This Test will challenge all of an agent's skills, including their speed, stealth and how clever they are,
During the Festival of Flight, a machine called the Cloud-Maker 3000 could make clouds of different shapes. Anvil clouds turned out to be surprisingly heavy!
These ultra-rare items are only available to those who have entered at least 5 codes into the Treasure Book. Codes can be found on games, books and other Club Penguin toys.

Art: Rockslide at the Mine card image
Comment: In January 2010, the whole island was surprised by a rockslide in the Mine. Construction crews quickly cleaned up the mess, and discovered a number of hidden caves.
Mer-penguins have shown up in many places. From the Underwater Adventure Stage play, to the Island Adventure Party, mer-penguins are a welcome addition to any celebration.
One of the many hazards that Aqua Grabber pilots need to avoid. These puffer fish can inflate to almost a hundred times their normal size, and their spikes can do a lot of damage.
Released during the Earth Day celebration in 2010, this watering pack keeps water from freezing, now penguins can water their gardens no matter how cold it is.

Art: Fixing the Mine Shack card image
Comment: During the Earth Day celebration, penguins decided it was time to fix up the Mine Shack. So everyone pitched in to help build a large community garden there.
Come one, come all, to the great Puffle Circus! Only in town during the Fair, penguins can see puffles of all colors perform amazing acts!
This sketch shows a yellow and blue puffle using items from their "super plays". It was used for an Aunt Arctic article, and it inspired the webpage we use for our Puffle Documentary video.
During Medieval Party 2010 , a new Knight's Quest appeared. This quest brought adventurers into a cave filled with puzzles, and fearsome statues of its owner...
An unexpected pile of popcorn appeared at the Ski Village in May 2010, so penguins decided to throw a Popcorn Party. It took two weeks to eat the whole pile!
During the island's annual Puffle Party, each puffle color has a room decorated in its honor. When the white puffle was discovered, the Mine was turned into an icy paradise.
This sketch shows a small part of the green puffle room from the Puffle Party of 2010. The final picture made the cover of the newspaper!
One of the more unusual igloo designs, the Fishbowl Igloo lets you see the world from the eyes of a Fluffy fish. It can be found from time to time in the Better Igloos catalog.
The competition between pirates and captains reached epic proportions during the Island Adventure Party. A great battle awaited those who dared to join in!
Secret protectors of Club Penguin, the Elite Penguin Force can tackle any emergency. When the PSA was destroyed by Herbert, the EPF took over all secret agent operations.
Whenever Rockhopper visits Club Penguin, he writes down all the things he's looking forward to doing. He posts this list on the notice board down in the Migrator's Hold.
This weirdly shaped but strangely comfortable hat was brought by Rockhopper in June of 2010. Penguins has voted it their favorite out of three possible hats, including a bucket and an old boot!
Deep underground is a secret cave filled with water, called the Hidden Lake. To find it, you'll need to journey into the caves beyond the mine, or find the other hidden entrance...
October 2010 saw a return of the spooky igloo contest. Penguins who picked up costumes and furniture items can keep the spine-chilling style all year 'round.

Card name: Halloween Countdown! (named "Halloween Countdown" in real-life cards)
Comment: We prepared for Halloween 2010 with a chilling countdown and creepy costumes. Then, we searched for candy in the Swamp Quest.
Stormy skies rolled over the island and cast shadows over October 2010's Halloween festivities. In November the dark clouds burst with the first ever rain in Club Penguin.
October 24th 2010 was the 5th Anniversary Party in Club Penguin. Penguins earned a Celebration Stamp for blowing out the candles on the massive cake in the Coffee Shop.
Club Penguin turned five at the October 24th Anniversary Party! Penguins found a party hat and orange puffles were excited to share the giant Anniversary cake.
During the Anniversary Party of 2010, we celebrated the past year with a brand new Yearbook and original penguin artwork in the Book Room.

Card name: Snowball Fight! (named "Snowball Fight" in real-life cards)
Comment: Snowball: a ball of snow pressed together to throw. Or... an excuse to get your snow gear on and head to the Snow Forts for a frozen fight!
Challenge your buddy to a game of Find Four in the Ski Lodge. While you're there, you may also see a giant mullet, a moose head and Fred the Cuckoo clock bird.
After playing in the snow or at the Ice Rink with your white puffle, chill together by the fire at the Ski Lodge.

Card name: Holiday Decorations! (named "Holiday Decorations" in real-life cards)
Comment: The Holiday Party 2010 was full of festive costumes and igloo items. In typical penguin fashion, we were thrilled to decorate our igloos... and ourselves.
The Book Room above the Coffee Shop is filled with Yearbook memories and tall tales, too! You might even discover a few secrets inside some of the pages...
After putting on their creepy costumes in the October Penguin Style, Frankenpenguins and other monsters braved their way through the Forest to find the Haunted House .
The brown puffle pet is super smart, inventive, and wears safety goggles. It's a good thing because its rocket is a bit unpredictable.

Art: Fun at the Fair! card image
Comment: At The Fair in September 2010, we played games, earned tickets and won fabulous prizes! Puffles and penguins performed magic tricks at stages Rockhopper brought.
Sledding is the perfect way to spend time with your buddies. Just head to top of the Ski Hill, and check out the Toboggan or Racing Sleds in the Game Upgrades catalog.
During the Holiday Party 2010, penguins got their skates from the Snow and Sports catalog and spent time with their buddies at the Ice Rink.
When the Migrator docks at the Beach, you can play Rockhopper's special Treasure Hunt game. Find it, and maybe find a few really rare gems, in the Captain's Quarters.
The Lumberjack Look outfit from the January Penguin Style catalog got us in the spirit of adventure! We needed it to complete the Wilderness Expedition 2011.
In January 2011 the Pink Sparkly Snowshoes hit Penguin Style just in time for the Wilderness Expedition. Who says exploration gear can't be stylish?
The Holiday Party 2010 was full of surprises. Penguins discovered a mysterious room called " ??? ". There, they found the biggest and brightest tree ever seen in Club Penguin.
During Coins For Change 2010 , Rockhopper challenged everyone to "Fill the Lighthouse!" Penguins gave over 12 billion Club Penguin coins that helped real kids around the world.
Penguin explorers had to make this elevator machine work during the Wilderness Expedition in January 2011. Experts presume the brown puffle invented it.
Building the boat during the Wilderness Expedition in January 2011 was a challenge. But getting to adopt a brown puffle across the bay was worth it.
During the Wilderness Expedition in January 2011, we completed several challenges, including a maze and a boat ride across the bay. Then we discovered the brown puffle!
In November 2010, even before the rain clouds flooded the island, penguins at work were finding leaks and looking for messes to mop .
Brave ninjas can battle opponents at the Waterfall behind the Dojo and earn Water Suits . Press 'D' when you wear only your suit and demonstrate your power to control water.
Your Stamp Books help you track the things you've done on the island. And while you can't really turn yourself into one, you CAN customize yours!
We geared up in expedition gear from Penguin Style and then found adventures during the Wilderness Expedition in January 2011. In the end, we discovered the brown puffle!
Protecting the Earth, Building Safe places and Providing Medical Help are things we can rally around! During Coins For Change 2010, penguins gave over 12 billion Club Penguin coins. Yes, BILLION!
Penguins can choose their color from the Penguin Style catalog! In 2006 players voted to get Lime Green added, and in 2009 players chose Aqua over lavender and maroon.
September 2010 saw a return of the popular Fairy Fables play at the Stage. Penguins interested in acting auditioned for the roles of characters like Twee and the Big Bad Wool.

Art: Penguins That Time Forgot card image (ID 632)
Comment: "Penguins That Time Forgot" hit the Stage again in January 2011. Actors clamored to the Costume Trunk to get their Time-Traveler's hats , Tiki Masks and their Big Brows .
This sketch was created when the Elite Penguin Force agents started doing Field Ops in June 2010. Secret agents work together to get things done.
The Cove is a place we go to tell stories and play the Catchin' Waves game. If you've taken on the waves there, you've probably got some extreme tales to tell.
During the Fair in September 2010, the orange puffle joined the circus and zoomed around the tent it its vehicle. The finale was eating the car.
The first ever game in Club Penguin, Hydro Hopper was formerly known as Ballistic Biscuit. Head to the Dock to grab your inner tube and challenge the waters.
To change up your igloo, choose a new design, get some furniture items, and decorate. Then throw a party and invite your friends.
During Underwater Adventure, brave penguin divers go on a journey. Along the way they discover a grumpy fish who tells them about the lost city of Penglantis.

Herbert made his first appearance in the PSA mission " Questions for a Crab ". After capturing a Secret Agent, he explained his life story and dastardly plans. His flow chart contained over 30 hand drawn pages.
Agents must protect against many different kinds of enemies in the game System Defender. Each has its own strengths and weaknesses. Find out more in G's tutorial in the Command Room.
In the Book Room, find these special books to hone your keyboard skills, shape your own story, and even find a few secrets!
Classified: To become an Elite Agent, respond to an invitation from another agent. Then head to the Everyday Phoning Facility to take the training test. Your duty? Protect the island.
Fireworks filled the sky during 2010's New Year's celebrations . This particular image appeared on the front page of the December 21, 2010 edition of the Club Penguin Times .
The brains of the Elite Penguin Force, the Tech Class, are technology experts. Dressed as civilians, they shut down enemy defenses via their computers.
In May 2010, Herbert's popcorn explosion meant we had to replace the Sport Shop with the Everyday Phoning Facility. Nothing unusual ever happens there...
Black puffles often look grumpy. But don't let their exterior fool you. They're excellent pets who excel with skateboards... They'll even help you in the Cart Surfer game.
Smashing your opponents off the 'berg will get you one step closer to conquering the island. Sumo Smash is a game made especially for Club Penguin's Game Day for Wii.
Very inventive, your brown puffle will surprise you with its elaborate creations. Adopt this machine-making puffle from the Pet Shop!
Reindeer, elves and puffles were seen gathering around the massive tree during the December 2010 Holiday Party. We decorated it ourselves!

These three Boss Bugs were sketched in the summer of 2010. The artists wanted them to look as if they could harm a computer system. Elite Agents can attack these Club Penguin enemies in System Defense in the Command Room.
Adventurous penguins can puffles made their way through the Tall Trees to find the new brown puffle during the Wilderness Expedition in January 2011.
Teamwork is key when you're flying down the hill on a sled with your friends in Sled 'n Slide game for Wii... Get a good time and your team will be closer to conquering Club Penguin Island!

Art: Underwater at the Stage card image
Comment: For a long time, players asked for a stage set under the water. So the Club Penguin team made one! In Underwater Adventure, you can get the costumes of Toby the Lobster, a Mermaid, or a Merman.
During the Wilderness Expedition, we had to take a boat to get across the bay. But first we had to build it and put our lifejackets on!

Card name: Catch the Mullet! (named "Catch the Mullet" in real-life cards)
Comment: From the Lodge, you can get to the Ice Fishing game and catch fish. Shhhh... To get the giant mullet use a smaller fish as bait!
"Step right up to the most daring, extravagant, ama-a-a-a-zing puffle circus!" Talented puffles performed and Ringmasters directed the shows during The Fair 2010.
It's intense and it has some incredible skate tricks, too. If you want some Cart Surfer help, or just a really cool pet, adopt a black puffle from the Pet Shop.
Club Penguin artists had a lot of fun sketching how the brown puffle might play. The scientific pet was discovered during the Wilderness Expedition in January 2011.
Race your opponents to the finish line! The Java Jump game in Club Penguin's Game Day for Wii will have you jumping... unless you pick up a heavy anvil along the way.
The opening of the Water Dojo is November 2010 meant a celebration of all elemental skills in Club Penguin. Puffles like the elements, too.
Fairy Fables is the tale of Prince Redwood who rides through the forest to take croissants to a princess. Check the Stage for a trunk full of costumes and acting opportunities.
First discovered in the Forest in 2007, yellow puffles are artistic pets. Adopt one from the Pet Shop and take it into your igloo. Then watch it get creative!
The green puffle's a great pal for getting silly. Adopt one at the Pet Shop and try taking it into the Jetpack Adventure game at the Beacon.

Card name: EPF Test Room (named "EPF Test Room Sketch" in real-life cards)
Comment: It takes a long time to plan new rooms. Artists sketched the Elite Agent training and testing room in January 2010, way before the Everyday Phoning Facility opened for Elite Agents at the end of May 2010.
In Club Penguin Game Day for Wii, winning snowball battles take precision. But it also helps if you know a secret... find the white puffle for some extra snowball action!
It's particular â€“ except when it's on the dance floor. Then it'll show you some great moves. Adopt one from the Pet Shop and then take it to the Dance Contest game to help you.
This early sketch of the Water Dojo had a few more "polished" elements than it does now. We wanted the area to be quite rough and even a bit perilous to reflect the challenge of the water game.
Known for its willingness to chomp on everything, the orange puffle is a wacky pet. Adopt yours at the Club Penguin Pet Shop â€“ and keep an eye on your pizza.
Pink puffles are sporty creatures â€“ they also like water. Adopt a pink puffle at the Pet Shop and take it into the Aqua Grabber game to help you!
You've picked your team... your skates are laced tight. Now guard your net and shoot pucks for the win! Goal!
First spotted in the Dojo, the shy, snow-loving white puffle holds extraordinary power. Adopt one from the Club Penguin Pet Shop.
Loyalty is what blue puffles are all about. If you're looking to expand your team with an all-star pet, adopt one in the Pet Shop.
All the puffles are hungry in the Club Penguin Wii "Feed A Puffle" Game. But try extra hard to feed a white one â€“ you can get a Stamp in Club Penguin when you feed one.

Ninjas compete fiercely in the Dojo to improve their Card-Jitsu skills. After earning their Ninja Mask, many continue to battle to keep their senses sharp. New Power Cards can surprise even the most skilled opponents.

Art: The Mystery of Sensei card image
Comment: Sensei's past is shrouded in mystery. He is the first master of Card-Jitsu, but little else is known about him. He will, however gladly train any student interested in the ways of the ninja. Seek him in the Dojo for training.

Even after you've earned their Ninja Mask, your ninja's training has only begun. The next step of your journey is to master the elements. Search the Ninja Hideout for paths to new Dojos... and new challenges.

The Brown Puffle was first discovered in January 2011. Explorers crossed a hidden bay into the wilds of Club Penguin, and found them in a cave. Many puffles even followed the explorers back. Adopt one today the Pet Shop.

Fire Ninjas who wear all the parts of their Fire Suit can control fire by pressing 'D' on their keyboard. Many used this power to help melt snow and pump water during the Water Dojo construction in November 2010.

Art: Black Puffles in Cart Surfer card image
Comment: In October 2010, black puffles were found exploring the Mine. It was quickly discovered that they were interested in Cart Surfing. To take your black puffle along, just walk to the Mine and start a game.
During August 2010, a Mountain Expedition was organized to climb to the top of Toughest Mountain. Many teams of penguins suited up with new climbing gear, and worked together to face the mountain.
Climbers faced many obstacles during the Mountain Expedition in August 2010. Icy caverns and harsh weather made the climb very tiring. Many stopped to rest at base camp before climbing to the summit.

Card name: Top of Toughest Mountain (named "Top of the Tallest Mountain" in real-life cards)
Art: Top of Toughest Mountain card image
Comment: The final challenge for climbers during the Mountain Expedition in August 2010 was to reach the top. Many who did took a picture to celebrate, which could then be used as a player card background !

To earn all the Stamps in Cart Surfer, you'll need practice... and a little help. For some of the challenges, surfers will need to bring a black puffle with them. You can adopt one of these from the Pet Shop.

Stamps Books tell YOUR story. Inside you'll find all the pins you've found, the games you've mastered, and the medals you've earned. Customize yours to show others what you like... and what you can do!
Dark and stormy skies continued to cover the island after the 2010 Halloween Party was over. No one could explain the mysterious weather at first â€“ even Gary the Gadget Guy was baffled.

What do Water Ninjas look like when they're controlling water? That's the question we asked while working on these sketches. We tried lots of different designs, making the water look 'smooth' and 'froamy', until we found the way we liked best.

When the Halloween Storm arrived in October 2010, Gary the Gadget Guy was puzzled. "I had never experienced a storm like it before," he said. "I watched it closely through the binoculars at the Cove. It was very intriguing."
Card-Jitsu Water is a fast paced battle. It takes quick thinking and fast flippers to master. Those who do will earn their Water Suit, a Water Gem, and the right to call themselves a Water Ninja.

In November 2010, it rained for the first time in Club Penguin history. For days the downpour soaked the island. Weather experts were baffled, and penguins everywhere were spotted with umbrellas and rain gear.

Ninjas must give their all facing one another in battle. Though matches are fierce, Sensei teaches that competition is the best way to improve your skill. Win or lose, ninjas always remain loyal allies, so remember to tell your opponent "good game!"

Art: Earning the Water Suit card image
Comment: Each part of the Water Ninja Suit is a symbol of skill. They must be earned in order â€“ first the Water Sandals , then the Waterfall Coat and the Torrent Mask . Once you earn the Helmet of Oceans , you're ready to face Sensei.
A rainstorm drenched the island in November 2010. At Sensei's request, workers set up machines to pump rainwater up to the Dojo. The machines ran on snowballs and Fire Ninja flames!

Art: Preparing the Water Dojo card image
Comment: During November 2010, everyone helped pump rainwater up to the Dojo. This water was needed to build a new Dojo for Water Ninja training. For a week, much of the island was covered in pipes and water tanks.

Art: Gate to the Water Dojo card image
Comment: The path to the Water Dojo begins in the Ninja Hideout. Once you have an Amulet, touch the stone tablet marked with a sater [4] symbol. A gate will appear and open. Enter it, if you are prepared...
When a ninja wears all the parts of the Water Suit, they will have the power to control water. Wearing only the suit, press 'D', and a wave of water will surge around you.

Art: Sign From The Elements card image
Comment: The rainstorm in November 2010 was a sign that ninjas were ready to master the element of water. Sensei soon announced the construction of the Water Dojo. It opened on November 25... and Card-Jitsu Water training began.

Card name: Sensei - Master of Water (named "Sensei-Master of Water" in real-life cards)
Art: Sensei - Master of Water card image
Comment: During construction of the Water Dojo in November 2010, Sensei appeared in the Ninja Hideout. Dressed in his Water Robe, he helped ninjas prepare... and showed them what the power of a Water Ninja could do.

Art: Water Ninja Poster Sketch card image
Comment: This rough sketch was an idea for a poster, showing all the different parts of the new Card-Jitsu Water game. We wanted to make it feel like the beginning of an ancient legend or story. That's why Sensei is so big â€“ he's not a giant, it's just for style!

This sketch of a Water Ninja was created for a membership card design. We wanted to show how it feels to become a Water Ninja â€“ to have such awesome power and skill. That's why we left off his mask â€“ we wanted to see his expression!

Art: Water Beats Fire Sketch card image
Comment: When we were designing what Water Ninjas looked like, it helped to sketch them in different battle poses. We really like this early drawing we found in an artist's sketch book.
"Dude. Soooo love the shades. They make me even stronger and more silent. Maybe later we can hang out and I'll eat a Puffle O to entertain 'ya."
"You think this is fast? You should see how I move when I get shot from a cannon! It's a riot! And I think, actually, it increases happiness."
"Paints, creativity, and music," Chirp replies with whimsy. "Mix those up with some imagination and you got a masterpiece, my friends, a masterpiece!"
"I love bubbles! They're beautiful to blow. Bouncy. Breathtaking. Transparent perfection, I say!"
When a ninja wears all the parts of the Water Suit, they will have the power to control weather. Wearing only the suit, press 'D', and a wave of water will surge around you. [10]
"Um, nope! Can't touch this propeller hat," Flit laughs loudly. "It takes tons of practice... Even I need it! Recall Christmas 2008 when I got stuck sideways in a tree?!"
"It's so cool to bounce around like my ball," he declares. "By the way... it rolled under a ginormous pile of snow and though I'm small, round and can roll, I'm a bit too puffy. Can you help?"

Art: ED MCCOOL AND DESTRUCTO card image
Comment: "Dear Gary, met two very talented puffles on an important PSA mission today. Will have to keep a look out for them in the future. They may be useful someday..."
"From this snowman emerges the almighty Niblet, the might green puffle! He's been trying to become a white puffle by hiding in the snow."
Penguins and puffles never get tired of the snow falling in Club Penguin. Best friends like to take some timeout from their busy life to watch it fall together.

Art: PUFFLES ON THE LOOSE card image
Comment: Sometimes rounding up puffles feels a little like chasing a rainbow. Lots of colors, but the closer you get the farther away it seems.

Art: CADENCE AND THE KEEPER card image
Comment: "Yeah, this little green guy is an epic win," Cadence grinned. "He's got all the right moves. He usually knows where the party's at. He's definitely a Keeper, lolz!"
Such a popular myth, they made a Stage play about it. Does this puffle really live under the 'berg?
Swoosh, the mysterious meteor puffle flies through the air with the greatest of ease...
A multi-colored legend, or just a creative little yellow puffle who has been playing with paint?
"I'm telling ya, it was huge! Twice the size of a penguin and it had claws like a crab. I was shaking in my snow boots!"
"Turbo is my black puffle. It rolls its eyes a lot," replies the penguin as he feeds his pet a flipper full of Puffle O's. "It really gets fired up when I take it out for a walk."
"As an employee, I value the blue puffles," replies the staff member. "They are loyal, easy to take care of, and fun to play ball with. You can't go wrong with a blue puffle."
"This is my pink puffle, Cutie! I named it that because I think its eyes are sooo adorable," continues the ballet dancer. "Plus it matches my outfit!"
"My puffle Greenie is the silliest puffle I've ever met, which is why we get along so well," she giggles. "I love it when it plays on its unicycle â€“ it's so funny!"
"Oh! Look at that one over there blowing bubbles! That one is sooo cute â€“ it should be my pet," she exclaims. "I'll make it Princess Purple because I love princesses and purple!"
"This is my sidekick on my adventures. I named it Fireball because it's so fast when it goes flying out of its cannon like whooooosh! Look, it's going again!"
"I knew I wanted a yellow puffle from the moment I saw it in the Forest at Halloween," she replies. "My puffle Lemon likes to paint just like I do."
This card does not exist in real-life, and as such has no description
